channel.title: AI & Labor Market Research Database
channel.description: A curated collection of economics papers on the labor market impact of AI and automation.

item.title: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on the Labor Market
item.description: Novel method linking AI patent text to O*NET task descriptions. Finds AI exposure is highest for well-paid, educated workersâ€”contrasting with previous automation waves that hit middle-skill workers hardest.
item.author: Michael Webb

item.title: Robots and Jobs: Evidence from US Labor Markets
item.description: Landmark study finding that each robot added per 1,000 workers reduced employment-to-population ratio by 0.2% and wages by 0.42%. Effects concentrated in manufacturing and among workers without college degrees.
item.author: Daron Acemoglu, Pascual Restrepo

item.title: What Can Machine Learning Do? Workforce Implications
item.description: Framework for understanding which tasks are susceptible to ML automation. Identifies prediction as the key capability, and argues displacement effects depend on whether ML complements or substitutes for human judgment.
item.author: Erik Brynjolfsson, Tom Mitchell
